Articles.Content:
So a lot of cars that drive well and for a long time are usually extremely big and clunky or have ugly clipping galore. this design is a neat and fits into a little space. it is low budget as there are no rtgs. Also if you do not like the way the brakes are tuned then you can adjust the rear or front brakes as you wish as i am not a brakes mechanic. 1 opens the doors and puts down the ladders-note wait for both doors and ladders to be engaged before retracting it because it might do weird things if u dont.

2 turns fuel cells on

3 turns them off

download

http://kerbalx.com/322997am/car
Forgot to mention that this thing does not do well on eve because of the g there.
Everybody hates cars

Quote

This is when i kicked one kerbal out

Amazing, prestigious idea. You should put an ejection mechanism on the passenger seat, just in case the driver is getting bothered.

And no, no one hates cars. Your car is no exception. In fact, it is one of the best car chassises that I've ever seen. Do you know what will actually happen in real life if a 30 ton bus falls onto a car?

See if you can fit a body on that chassis- try to experiment.

And no, no one hates cars. Your car is no exception. In fact, it is one of the best car chassises that I've ever seen. Do you know what will actually happen in real life if a 30 ton bus falls onto a car?

See if you can fit a body on that chassis- try to experiment. 

What do you mean fit a body? Do you mean redesign the top? Well I might do that. Also when a 30 ton bus crashes into a car then the car goes squish.

Looks like a good car, problem is that the majority of the pics either dont show the entire thing, or are zoomed really far out

 

Also everyone is awaiting the new 1.1 wheel physics, so cars are kinda out of the limelight

5 minutes ago, 322997am said:

ooooo...

...yeeeeeeah

I'm building e new iteration which is longer, has rockets and more batteries and solar panels but. The main difference is how it drives with how I tuned the wheels. What I did is I put in 2 struts  per wheel. This means that the car will be less vulnerable to lips and bumps just taking a wheel right off. Also this changes the way the car works with knocked out wheels. If you have 1 knocked out wheel then it veers a bit to the side the wheel is on. If u have 2 knocked out then diagonally it will function decently with compromised steering and speed. But if you have either both the back or both the front then you will have issues. If both front wheels are broken then it completely ignores where you tell it to go. It will not steer. But if both back are out then you will not be able to let an eye off of it without it spinning out. And if both sides are out then it will drive in circles. Any more the

an 2 wheels dead then you cannot drive. I will upload this tomorrow as it is not ready yet.
What do you think about the way it handles bumps and stuff?

new model its the s edition

same car just longer and changes to suspension
